<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Limit speed of given vehicle or person to given value (in km/h).

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> objectName '''limitSpeed''' speed

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> objectName: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> speed: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>// Adjust "speedLimit" variable to change limited speed. (A3 1.24 we don't need loop for a continus effect, [[limitSpeed]] alone is enough.)
_this [[setVariable]] ["speedLimit", 200];
_nul = _this [[spawn]] {
	[[while]] {[[canMove]] _this} [[do]] {
		_this [[limitSpeed]] (_this [[getVariable]] "speedLimit");
		[[sleep]] 0.1;
	};
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2 </name>=<value> <code>["SpeedObserver","onEachFrame",{[[hintSilent]] [[format]] ["%1",[[speed]] [[vehicle]] MyVehicle]},[]] [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_addStackedEventHandler]];
[[sleep]] 10;
MyVehicle [[limitSpeed]] 5; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>watch the effect of this command.</value></part></template>
</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[speed]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 9 February 2008</dd>
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Kronzky|Kronzky]]'''
<dd class="note">(A1 1.08.5163)Has only an ''temporary'' effect on the vehicle specified (i.e. vehicle goes back to its previous speed right away). So, in order for this command to have a ''real'', noticeable effect, it would have to be issued continuously (e.g. via a script loop, but in A3 1.24 it is unnecessary). 

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 29 July 2014</dd>
<dt class="note>'''[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]'''
<dd class="note">(A3 1.24)To clarify, [[limitSpeed]] only do effect on non-player controlled AI units, it has continuous effect and AI won’t break through the speed limitation until one is contacted, engaged or regrouped.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
